page.title: 19LIVING IN FORTON.
page.content: { A VILLAGER'S VIEWPOINT.} " FORTON IS A QUIET AND FRIENDLY VILLAGE, THOUGH THE PEACE IS SOMETIMES DISTURBED BY GOODS VEHICLES USING THE VILLAGE AS A SHORTCUT TO THE A518, THE STAFFORD ROAD. AT PEAK TIMES THE A519, THE ECCLESHALL ROAD, DOES GET BUSY. THE PEOPLE OF FORTON ARE MOSTLY COMMUTERS WHO WORK IN STAFFORD, NEWPORT, OR WOLVERHAMPTON. THE CHURCH IN FORTON IS AN IMPORTANT SOURCE OF ENTERTAINMENT AS WELL AS WORSHIP, WITH A THRIVING CHORAL GROUP. FOR SHOPPING A TWO MILE JOURNEY TO NEWPORT IS NECESSARY, THOUGH FOR A WIDER CHOICE A VISIT TO BIRMINGHAM OR SHREWSBURY WOULD BE MADE. IT IS THE QUIET COUNTRYSIDE AND THE ATTRACTIVE OUTLOOK THAT MAKES FORTON SO APPEALING."
